page.title: 06ORWELL ESTUARY,IPSWICH.
page.content: The wide estuary of the River Orwell connects Ipswich with the open North- Sea.It is a mud-lined,tidal estuary, which runs through beautiful open countryside and heavily built up industrial areas. The estuary is shared by both leisure craft and ocean going ships. The huge container and cargoe vessels, ease their way through the buouys and The well marked navigation channel and the hundreds of mooring posts for private small yachts. The ocean going ships carry cargoes of grain,timber,metal and coal,however, Ipswich as a port is under threat from the rival port of Felixstowe further down the estuary. A big issue of the 1980's is-"will the port of Ipswich suffer from the expansion of Felixstowe"? We wait and see!
